intro: Brachycorythis schweinfurthii var. nigerica, commonly known as the African violet, is a species native to tropical Africa. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Gesneriaceae family, characterized by its compact rosette of velvety, dark green leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in a range of colors, including purple, pink, and white, which bloom from the center of the leaves. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is widely cultivated as a houseplant.
